_header: Almighty God in His eternal magesty
Subjects: Wulfstan, saint, life of; saints’ lives; envoys; inscriptions
_description: The English Metrical Life of St Walstan, originally written on parchment and attached to a tryptych probably in Bawburgh Church, Norfolk — seventy-five stanzas rhyme royal and 8-line Envoy

Lam935.First Lines:
Almightie God in his aeternall majestiedisposing all things by his
                    providence…
Lam935.Last Lines:
…with Ghostly support to doo correctionThee To reforme as they
                    see needFinis
Lam935.Note:
Seventeenth-century transcription. ‘The owner Wm Clark
                    of Granthorpe in Suffolk, a Papist’. ‘Copied out of the Originall /
                    Sept. 29th Anno domini 1658’. The last two lines above are from
                    the colophon.
Lam935.Attributed Title:
The History of St Walston taken out of an antient parchment MS,
                    enclosed in a Case of 3 pieces of wood about a yard Long each of… (most
                    crossed out).
Lam935.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             “Lives of Saint Walstan.” 
             Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society, Proceedings
         19 (1917): 238-67: 250-67.
